column5: I'm looking forward to my trip to Vermillion Bay Lodge. It's in June, but I haven't counted the days. I do know it can't get here soon enough.
Crazy weather but I'll take it a y way I can.

We're doing our first fly-in trip in 246 days! It's going to be a long summer as we usually go up in June and this year we decided to go the first full week in September. We'll have to live vicariously through all of the WC'ers who post summaries of their trips throughout the early season and summer months.
217 days until we had to Lac Seul. Had to skip the 2018 trip so it's been two years for us, can't wait!

Two trips are planned and confirmed for this year......a third is most likely going to be on the fly....so to speak. Just setting up the first two trips with the owners has been a bit of a logistical dance; with a lot of conversations surrounding behavioral patterns, that aren't true, before my deposits would even be accepted. So conversations included: - Minnow Molestation -Crawler Cruelty - fishing in a birthday suit....ok I can see that as a possibility, but not on these 2 trips..too cold! - accused of being a Vikings fan.......I resent this vehemently ......I know my handle has horn in it, but that ain't what it means - fraternizing with Chicago guys in camp.....ain't happening unless they have good beer - poor pee aim in both a rental boat and in a cabin fixture....not true....ever. The stream is straight and true. - moonlight marauding....I'm not even sure what this means unless clothing is optional with a young lady who wants to fish under a moonlit night. I guess skeeter spray would be optional too. - accused of trying to change the Canadian word eh to A. - beaver shaving We shall see how these trips go with some new group members. It could be great......it could be a trip where the struggle is real ....... Best of luck to everyone on their 2019 trips. PjShorthorn
Pending the outcome of PJ's vetting process and acceptance of the deposit, it is 163 days before a week of fishing, friendship, and adventure at VBL.
219 days until I depart for Lac Seul Outposts at Chamberlain Narrows. Musky/Walleye trip for us, can't wait!
244 Days, 13 Hours, 3 Minutes and 15 Seconds until we leave!
245 days until we leave for Ghost River Lodges. wmd
132 and 176 days. 19th year going to Gullrock.Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Here we go again! How many days before you hit your favorite walleye spot!
I'll start you off with 156 days. Happy New Year!
I hope you have a great trip! Happy New Year!
I hope I am invited to go with stjoeguy in 156 days. wmd
All intentions are for our 19th return season to the South Shore ofLake of the Woods, May 6th. (125 days) Set the Hook, CRJohn
First off HAPPY NEW YEAR. Hoping to get to my spot Thursday.lol.-30 last night in the Vermilion Bay area,so going to let it warm up a few days.thurs will be near 0.
Happy New Year! 220 days until we leave for Miniss Lake with Slate Falls Outposts
156 and 184 days. Perrault Lake. Hoping for a great year!

Greetings, Prov1800: I thought the standard response in Canada, relative to the weather forecast, is that tomorrow's daytime temperature will be +1 degree! My first trip to Ontario is a short seventy two days away! Good fishing and tight lines!!
Will be in Wine Lake Camp one day before the opener, 135 of the slowest days known to mankind. Hooks
